**Device used:** Windows 11 / Chrome
**App Component:** Money Requests

## Action Performed:
Preconditions:
1. Log in as tester+mergetests@applausecard.expensifail.com
2. Navigate to the workspace chat

Steps:
1. Via the email inbox of tester@applausecard.expensifail.com account, open the compose email box and select tester+mergetests@applausecard.expensifail.com as the sender
2. Send the following receipt to receipts@expensify.com (receipt attached below)
3. Navigate back to ND

## Expected Result:
the receipt is uploaded and displayed on the workspace chat

## Actual Result:
the receipt is uploaded and displayed on Concierge chat

## Workaround:
Unknown

**Bug source:** Regression TC Execution
**Device used:** Android 14
**App Component:** Other

## Action Performed:
1. Log in to NewDot
2. On the URL change the conversation ID to any combination of 1-4 numbers. E.g https://staging.new.expensify.com/r/1234
3. Verify you briefly see the skeleton loader
4. Verify You see a Hmm... it's not here message in the conversation history
5. Repeat steps 2-4 twice

## Expected Result:
The “Hmm… it’s not here” page is displayed and remains visible for invalid conversation IDs.

## Actual Result:
The page appears briefly and then disappears instead of displaying the “Hmm… it’s not here” message.

Unknown

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.3.6-0
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** Yes
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79765
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester@applause.expensifail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration
**Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome
**App Component:** Workspace Settings

## Action Performed:
Precondition:
- Log in as domain admin (applausetester@applause.expensifail.com).

1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to Workspaces.
3. Scroll to the bottom.
4. Tap applause.expensifail.com domain.
5. Go offline.
6. Click Add admin.
7. Add a user as domain admin.
8. Click on the admin profile which was added in Step 7.
9. Click Revoke access.
10. Click Remove.
11. Click Settings.
12. Click Primary contact.
13. Search for the removed admin in Step 10.

## Expected Result:
Removed admin should no longer appear in Add primary contact list.

## Actual Result:
Removed admin is not removed from Add primary contact list offline.

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [x] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome

- [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.6-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176687/test-cases/41236712 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+hb+2101c@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** iphone promax 13, IOS 26.2 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions Use only expensifail account and don't use gmail account Create an Workspace and 4 accounts are needed for this TC: Account A: Workspace owner Account B: Workspace approver Account C: Vacation delegate As workspace owner [Account A], invite Account B,C,D to the workspace As workspace owner [Account A] set Account B as approver Account D: Workspace submitter As Workspace approver [Account B] select Account C for Vacation Delegate Account D submitted an expense to the Workspace chat ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. [Account C] logged in on hybrid app 3. Navigate to the expense report >> open the expense detail 4. Tap "More" 5. Select "Split" >>Tap "Save" 6. Long Tap one of the split expense and mark it as "Hold" expense 7. Tap "Approve" button and select "Approve only x.xx" button ## Expected Result: The "From" link should be consistently embedded in the approved expense across both hybrid app and web. ## Actual Result: • The unhealed expense approve has no embedded "From" link in the hybrid app. • On the web browser, the "From" link is correctly displayed. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7dc4c9d8-e5a9-4135-bce0-bb1f9715afb0 ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/87fdc9c3-be0e-4bd4-9b62-c4ed69698d36) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.6-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/79765 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+210102abc@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Log in as domain admin which is not primary contact. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Workspaces. 3. Scroll to the bottom. 4. Tap applause.expensifail.com domain. 5. Go to Domain admins. 6. Tap on your own profile. 7. Tap Revoke access. 8. Tap Remove. ## Expected Result: User will be redirected to Workspaces page after removing themselves as admin. ## Actual Result: Not here page opens after removing themselves as admin. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a708e411-a0c0-46cb-b927-6c67e3e265b0 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

___

**Version Number:**
**Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction  (Repro only in Android Emulator)
**Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:**
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):**
**Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856
**Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:**
**Issue reported by:** @hungvu193 
**Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): #[Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1768661857212849)

## Action Performed:
1. Login with any account
2. Go to any page
3. Press device back button
4. App is closed instead of going back previous page
## Expected Result:
It should go back to previous page instead of closing the App.
## Actual Result:
App is closed after pressing back button
## Workaround:
Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround?

## Platforms:

- [x] Android: App
- [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] iOS: App

- [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [ ] Windows: Chrome
- [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari

title: [$375] [Onyx] Investigate Reassure stability on CI

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C01GTK53T8Q/p1769093035654139?thread_ts=1768666683.491279&cid=C01GTK53T8Q). Looks like Reassure started to fail again on CI. Here's a [example PR](https://github.com/Expensify/react-native-onyx/pull/722). From our initial tests this flakiness is present on CI but not locally. We suspect that it started to fail after [this PR](https://github.com/Expensify/react-native-onyx/pull/689) was merged. I think we shouldn't focus on reverting changes of the PR but instead try to understand why this is happening and come up with a solution stabilize Reassure again on Onyx.

body:
## Background Coming from [this convo](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1768875279554969), we'd like to add a `Remove` button to the `Track distance` > `Map` flow, specifically on the page where you enter an individual address. Both on web and mobile. ## Details This is exactly where we want to add the `Remove` button, on the second screen below: cc @Expensify/design
